title: Three Property Portfolio

scenario_info.name: Multiple Properties with Different CGT Treatments
scenario_info.description: Investment portfolio with three properties sold in the same financial year. Each property has different CGT treatment: family home (full MRE), investment unit (no exemption), holiday house (no exemption, mixed use).
applicable_rules: Property A: Full MRE - main residence entire period
Property B: No exemption - pure investment from day one
Property C: No exemption - holiday house with occasional rental
ITAA97 s115.25: 50% CGT discount applies to B and C
Capital gains aggregated for the financial year

properties.notes: Family home - main residence entire ownership period. Full MRE applies. Net capital gain: $0

properties.address: Unit 8/120 Brunswick Street, Fortitude Valley QLD 4006

property_history.description: Rented from day one as pure investment

properties.notes: Investment unit - rented from day one, never lived in. No MRE. Capital gain: $115,575. After 50% discount: $57,788

property_history.description: Used as holiday home - occasional personal use
Started renting on Airbnb when not using personally

properties.notes: Holiday house - not main residence, mixed personal/rental use. No MRE. Capital gain: $288,600. After 50% discount: $144,300

user_query: I'm selling three properties in the same year: my family home that I've lived in for 14 years, an investment unit I've had for 8 years, and a holiday house in Noosa that I've had for 6 years. What's my total CGT?
